page.title: 12CREWE STATION
page.content: JUNE/JULY 1985. Crewe station is closed so that the track layout can be changed. The old layout of 17 platforms,285 points & crossings and 3 signal boxes belonged to the age of steam when most trains had to change engines at Crewe. This has not been necessary since the introduction of electric engines about 25 years ago. Thus a layout which is cheaper and easier to maintain is being installed. A new Signalling Control Centre replaces the old signal boxes. New lines are being laid to allow non-stop trains to pass through at 80mph instead of 20-30mph. Stopping trains will be able to approach at faster speeds. Points & crossings will be reduced to 110. There will be fewer platforms and improved passenger facilities.
